title: Lawsuits Involving Off-Duty Officers (City Of Memphis)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A dataset (in electronic form such as .xlsx, .csv., etc) of cases where your government municipality defended, settled or received a judgment following a lawsuit (or arbitration) that stemmed from a police officer’s off-duty actions, which includes:
- Case numbers and titles
- Brief case descriptions
- Involved officer name(s)
- Amount and date of settlement or payment to any outside party
- Any legal costs to defend the case
- Any other type of action taken as part of any judgment/settlement

2. A list of cases, dates and involved parties names, where your government’s lawyers declined to defend a lawsuit alleging any kind of misconduct or policy violation from a sworn officer for actions related to off-duty behavior or off-duty employment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Aspen Ford.

title: Request for Off-Duty Payroll Records (Metropolitan Nashville Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A dataset of all approved applications from officers to the Off-Duty Work Detail Department for outside employment that includes the following columns:
- Date of application
- Names of officers
- Private employer
2. Payroll records including hours worked from private employers of authorized off-duty police officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Aspen Ford.

title: Policies for Outside Employment of Sworn Officers (Metropolitan Nashville Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All general orders, policies and procedures related to outside employment, detailing, secondary employment, off-duty work, or moonlighting of police officers.
2. Any and all versions of the General Orders/policies related to off-duty work or moonlighting since 2014.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Aspen Ford.

title: Public Records Request for Off-Duty Officer Contracts (Metropolitan Nashville Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All service contracts or agreements between the department and private companies that employ off-duty officers for security or other services.
2. Any amendments or modifications to the aforementioned contracts or agreements within the last five years.
3. All liability waivers between officers, the police department and the private employer.
4. Insurance policy (if applicable) between the department and insurance company that covers officers who perform off-duty jobs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Aspen Ford.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A list of officers approved for off-duty work
2. For those officers, any data related to on-duty policy violations or complaints filed against them
3. All data related to violations committed by off-duty officers. We would like this to include, if possible, case numbers, a violation description, date, time, location, officers involved, complaint outcome, and penalties assessed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Aspen Ford.
